The family of tragic schoolgirl Katie Rough - who was found with stab wounds a mile from her home - have released a touching video tribute to their daughter. 
The little girl was found with lacerations to her neck and chest in a playing field in her York home in Jaunary. 
And ahead of her funeral at York Minster on Monday mum Alison has led the tributes to the school girl. 
John Sentamu, Archbishop of York, will lead the service with the hashtag teamrough set up to allow family and friends to pay tribute. Katie in the video montage released by her family (Photo: Facebook Sarah Thornhill) The clip features moments from her life (Photo: Facebook Sarah Thornhill) 
The video, released on Facebook, shows many images of the little girl superimposed over piano music. 
They include pictures of her as a baby, singing and on a swing while enjoying experiences with family and friends. 
The montage includes the words "love", "always in our hearts" and "you are our sunshine". Katie enjoying an ice cream (Photo: Facebook Sarah Thornhill) Images including Katie with Santa (Photo: Facebook Sarah Thornhill) 
In one segment, it says: "Don't cry because it's over... smile because it happened." 
In January, the distraught mum of told how "life will never ever be the same again". 
A 15-year-old girl has been charged with her murder. Katie's family wrote messages in the video (Photo: Facebook Sarah Thornhill) The girl's funeral will be held on Monday (Photo: Facebook Sarah Thornhill) 
Writing on Facebook, her mum Alison said: "My beautiful beautiful sassy, kind, amazing girl. 
"I love her more than any words could even come close to explaining. Life will never ever be the same again. 
"My children, my grandson and my husband are my whole entire life, I live only for them" Paul and Alison Rough at a balloon release to mark what would have been Katie's 8th birthday (Photo: Ben Lack) The parents at the event (Photo: Ben Lack) Tattoos remembering Katie (Photo: Facebook) 
Katie's parents were pictured saying goodbye to their little girl on what would have been her eighth birthday back in January. 
The devastated family of Katie invited hundreds to release balloons in memory of the schoolgirl exactly a week after she was found with fatal injuries in a field on January 9. 
Hand-written messages were attached to 200 balloons before they were sent skywards at 4pm close to the family home in York. 
Katie was found with severe lacerations to her neck and chest on a playing field near a cul-de-sac in the Woodthorpe area of the city. Katie Rough (Photo: Internet Unknown) The balloon release event (Photo: Ben Lack) 
She was rushed to hospital but was pronounced dead shortly afterwards. 
Katie’s mum Alison, 38, reportedly raced to the scene and dropped to her knees screaming: “No, no, my little girl.” 
Witnesses told of their “deep shock” as they tried to comfort the distressed mum. 
During the tribute on Monday she was pictured close to tears in the arms of Katie's dad Paul as she celebrated her "special little girl's" life. Read More Grieving mum of 'murdered' Katie Rough appeals for help in finding 'missing 30 minutes' of 7-year-old's life Katie Rough (Photo: North Yorkshire Police) 
One member of Katie's family posted a message on the site which said: "Just wanted to once again say thanku to every1 who has donated the generosity of strangers is over whelming on behalf of my sister and the rest of the family thanku x." The crime scene (Photo: SWNS) Read More Katie Rough's heartbroken mum reveals tattoo tribute to daughter saying 'life will never be the same again' 
In a statement issued on behalf of the family, Katie's parents thanked people for their continuing support: "Katie was a beautiful, creative and special little girl who will be extremely missed by all who knew her. 
"Katie's parents, Paul and Alison, would like to thank everyone for their kind words and ongoing support through this very difficult and sad time." 
Hundreds of people are expected to pay their respects at the 1.30pm public service at York Minster. 
The family will also hold a charity fun day and a night of music next Saturday in Katie’s memory. Like us on Facebook
